messages: b478f4cb90492d824217595edc31e8a0 (19:01): I know there is a way, but I can't find it in the help files... how do I get vim to respond to mouse events when running in an xterm?
b478f4cb90492d824217595edc31e8a0 (19:02): awesome, thanks... can't believe I didn't find that :P
57897953747a17ba7b081b887ad1ab6b (19:02): One could go as far as to say vim has more features than is feasible to comb though :)
b478f4cb90492d824217595edc31e8a0 (19:02): true... but I still should have seen that when I did ":he mouse"
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:08): how do i add :hi Tag ctermfg=red to my .vimrc?
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:08): it says "not in editor mode", like i'm not supposed to say ":hi"
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (19:08): stu: lose the colon
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (19:09): just 'hi Tag ctermfg=red'
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:10): no, the colon is right
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:10): maybe it works without colon too, /me shrugs
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:10): point is, foolish me
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (19:10): I didn't know you could have commands with colons in .vimrc
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:11): every command in my .vimrc has a colon in front of it
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:11): yup, all 30 of them
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:11): which prolly means i'm doing it incorrectly :), but it works, so meh
85eb505ca144e27a6fa86ac226fd28c0 (19:12): snot so much incorrect as useless
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:12): it'd be like typing "::hi Tag ctermfg=red" while in Vim
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:20): so i've got 2 match lines, and 2 hi lines, in my .vimrc
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:21): my groups are 'tag' and 'label' .. after i open my source code, only 1 of them is highlighted
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:21): i can comment it out, and the other one is then highlighted
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:21): but i can't seem to get both to highlight
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:24): stu: only one at a time. Regex is your friend.
1f4df5ac35e26a8a8606273e7bc10e29 (19:24): guys, how do I make a substitution with capture in vim?
1f4df5ac35e26a8a8606273e7bc10e29 (19:24): i tried perl's syntax but it did not work
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:24): work_donato: \1, not $1
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:24): stu: if you're using vim7, you have :match and :2match
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:25): and \1 works in perl too.
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:25): work_donato: what Zathrus said and you need to escape the ()
1f4df5ac35e26a8a8606273e7bc10e29 (19:25): Zathrus: thank you
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:25): jamessan: I replied before he said that! :)
85eb505ca144e27a6fa86ac226fd28c0 (19:27): though \1 is a hack in Perl on RHS
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:28): Zathrus: they are only 1 at a time
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:29): stu: you can either use jamessan's suggestion of 2match on vim7, or you can construct a regex that matches both.
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:30): why should they even be related?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (19:30): this sounds like a job for syntax highlighting, not :match
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:30): i mean, thats all i want to do
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:30): but i dont know why this doesn't work
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:31): stu: you don't understand. You cannot have multiple matches at once. This is not an incremental process.
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:31): stu: when you do :match it _replaces_ the old match.
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:31): Zathrus: okay.. you're right i don't understand
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:31): because its a different group i'm matching to, i thought it'd be okay
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:32): the group specifies a highlight group, nothing more.
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:33): again, vim7 allows for two matches via :match and :2match
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:33): i'm saying "if it the $line matches this regex, call it $this_group"
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:33): atleast i thought that was what i was saying
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:33): s/call it/highlight it as/
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:33): i'm not arguing with you because obviously you're right
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:33): right, highlight it as
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:34): stu: you're not defining a group though. You're merely saying what to color it as.
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:35): it could be clearer in the docs that each invocation will cause previous invocations to be forgotten
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:35): that's certainly not clear, I can see why the confusion occurred
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:35): i figured, for each line in the file, it would see if any of my regex's match the line, and if so, set the matched string as a member of group
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:35): that sounds more like you want to write a syntax file
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:35): thought i want to use a different method completely
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:36): there's also a :3match
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:36): yeah, i saw, i :he 2match
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:36): just making sure :) -- I'm not trying to beat you up. As jamessan said, the docs are unclear
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:37): yeah, no i appreciate it
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:37): i will write a sytnax file when i learn how
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:38): all i care about is highlighting text based on regex's
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:38): any way i can do that is cool with me :)
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (19:38): syntax files are pretty easy. it's one of the first things I learned how to do
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:38): i find documentation for vim to suck ass
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:38): once you know vim, the docs are pretty good
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:38): but i think they suck
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:39): thats what i learned first
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (19:39): hey Zathrus, are you familiar with the clause "one of"?
fb2c4f3e688db2a676f292cd15961a59 (19:40): tpope: you know I was kidding.
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:41): okay... i'd love to play more
0b2d182efae23710a3f4f438e1744306 (19:41): but i have a conference call at noon and i got deliverables that aren't ready to be delivered
